title: What Communists Do
sub_head: The Beijing dictatorship finds another way to crack down on a courageous dissident.
body:
Media entrepreneur and democracy advocate Jimmy Lai has been arrested again in Hong Kong as China’s communist dictatorship tightens its grip on the former British colony. The latest dubious government claim is that a minor commercial dispute over office space amounts to fraud. But it’s clear that Mr. Lai’s real offense is that he courageously stands for liberty.
“We are really to the point where Beijing is just being honest. These charges are a communist regime admitting they have nothing, so they will make up something,” says Mr. Lai’s colleague Mark Simon.
